column4: hello. I am using Ubuntu Maverick i386 in a Toshiba A215-S5837 and it would be nice if someone teach me how to get control of the FAN. I mean it is very slow and the computer is overheating, how to put it on max forever?
after installed i get : required kernel toshiba support not enabled
i have no problem using fnfx shortcuts...
my only problem is with the fan
it get fast when hot and slow when "cold"... but it still very hot at all.. i want it aways on
check out this thread. Other post I have read is either update your bios or compile your own kernel which is not recommended
bash: /proc/acpi/fan/FAN/state: File or directory not found
what happens when you hit fn+f3
give it a go hopefully it works for you, but i have to go out so good luck!
